parameters.description: This method requires user authentication .

parameters.name: authentication
parameters.description: This method controls access via authentication . Oauth is NOT needed but an application key (app_key query string parameter) is required.

parameters.name: keywords string
parameters.description: The search keywords. (optional)

parameters.name: location string
parameters.description: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122") and venue IDs ("V0-001-000268633-5"). Common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is required in order to set a search radius. (optional)

parameters.name: date string
parameters.description: Limit this list of results to a date range, specified by label or exact range. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Exact ranges can be specified the form 'YYYYMMDD00-YYYYMMDD00', for example '2012042500-2012042700'; the last two digits of each date in this format are ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: category string
parameters.description: Limit the search results to this category ID. A list of categories may be specified separated by commas. See /categories/list for a list of categories and their IDs. (optional)

parameters.name: ex_category string
parameters.description: Exclude search results from including this category ID. A list of categories may be specified separated by commas. See /categories/list for a list of categories and their IDs. (optional)

parameters.name: within integer
parameters.description: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. (optional)

parameters.name: units string
parameters.description: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". (optional)

parameters.name: count_only boolean
parameters.description: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_order string
parameters.description: One of 'popularity', 'date', or 'relevance'. Default is 'relevance'. (optional)

parameters.name: sort_direction string
parameters.description: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. (optional)

parameters.name: page_size integer
parameters.description: The desired number of results per page. (optional)

parameters.name: page_number integer
parameters.description: The desired page number. (optional)

parameters.name: image_sizes string
parameters.description: A comma separted list of image_sizes desired. See Faq for list of possible image sizes. (optional)

parameters.name: languages integer
parameters.description: Return our guess of each event language. ("Undetermined" is a possibility) (optional)

parameters.name: mature string
parameters.description: Sets the level of filtering for events marked as "mature" due to keywords in the title or description. One of 'all' (no filtering), 'normal', or 'safe'. 'Normal' mature filtering consists of words that are clearly profanities and inappropriate for younger audiences. 'Safe' mature filtering consists of all normal mature filtered words, as well as other terms that may be used as inappropriate innuendo. A 'safe' filter may eliminate events that are benign in nature, but contain questionable content based on keywords. Defaults to 'all'. (optional)

parameters.name: include string
parameters.description: Indicates that optional sections should be included in the result XML. Multiple section names can be indicated, separated by commas (e.g. 'categories,links'). Sections include 'categories', 'subcategories', 'popularity', 'tickets', 'price', and 'links'. (optional)

parameters.name: change_multi_day_start boolean
parameters.description: If set changes the start_date of long duration events (lasting multiple days) to the beginning of the search date range. It will also give the next occurence of a recurring event after the start range. This will prevent an event from appearing to be outside the date range requested . (optional)

parameters.description: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. (optional)

parameters.description: Default "en-US".

parameters.description: Required by RSS 2.0 format.

parameters.name: item tag
parameters.description: Each item entry has the following structure: title string The event title. description string The event description. In RSS, this includes the start time, end time, venue, venueid, tags, and description. category string Unused. pubDate string The start date and time of the event. (e.g. "Mon, 26 Sep 2005 08:33:28 -0700") guid string The unique ID for this event, it is the event's Eventful URL. link string URL of associated event on Eventful site.

parameters.description: Each item entry has the following structure: title string The event title. description string The event description. parameters.description: The event title. (optional)

parameters.name: start_time string
parameters.description: The event start time, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). (optional)

parameters.name: stop_time string
parameters.description: The event stop time, if any, in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). (optional)

parameters.name: tz_olson_path string
parameters.description: The event timezone, as listed in the Olson timezones database (e.g. "America/New_York") (optional)

parameters.name: all_day boolean
parameters.description: True ("1") if the event is an all-day event, false ("0") otherwise. (optional)

parameters.name: description string
parameters.description: The event description. (optional)

parameters.name: privacy integer
parameters.description: The privacy setting for this event. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private) (optional)

parameters.name: tags string
parameters.description: A space-delimited list of tags. (optional)

parameters.name: free boolean
parameters.description: True ("1") if the event is free, false ("0") otherwise. (optional)

parameters.name: price string
parameters.description: A text string describing the event price. For example, this could indicate a price range ("$15 - $35"), free but donations requested ("$10 donation suggested"), or other special instructions ("Adults $15, children under eight $5"). Don't pass this parameter or leave it blank if there is no price information. (optional)

parameters.name: venue_id integer
parameters.description: The ID of the venue where this event occurs. Use /venues/new or /venues/search retrieve an appropriate ID. (optional)

parameters.name: parent_id string
parameters.description: The ID of this event's parent event. If empty, removes the parent event. (optional)

parameters.name: app_key string
parameters.description: [required] Application key as provided by Eventful

parameters.name: oauth_fields string
parameters.description: [optional or required depending on specific API call] Oauth parameters (token,signature,etc). Most calls that modify or add data require Oauth, most calls that just lookup information do not require Oauth
